content: he dare stir him up: who then
no air can come between them.
another; they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
Clubs are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the rushing of the javelin.
a threshing wain upon the mire.
He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like ointment.
He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
Upon earth there is not his like, that is made without fear.
He beholdeth every thing that is high: he is king over all the sons of pride.
